Why are people getting so worked about what ending is better? I personally prefer the shota ending, although this one wasn't as bad as I thought. I'm more just looking at the meaning of each relationship and while this one is still sweet, it still seems much more bitter than with Haru. Gouda is by no means a shitty guy and you can see that he has changed a bit, but his personality just isn't the most likable. Plus, while Haru's and Saya's relationship could be compared to prostitution, didn't Gouda's start like that as well? Haru was only copying what he saw. However, everyone is entitled to their own opinion. What really confuses me is the reverse pissing contest in this comment section about whether its better that the 15 year old or the 30 year old did the dickin. Like, why? Just fuckin why?
It's more wholesome than I thought it would be, but I would much rather the shota gets a wedding end.

@PatheticLoser Your post makes me think you didn't read the last canon one. Haru was learning how to please her quite well...learning all her most sensitive spots and everything. He's also not small "down there" anymore. As for being able to take care of her...unfortunately he's only fifteen...but with how much he cares about her and tries so hard for her, I don't doubt that he'll be able to support her in the long run.
Considering how the author did this one and the prequel...makes me think he preferred this couple. I mean, we don't even get to see her and Haru-kun's married life... :/
I like the original but damn this spin-off is good. That last romp in the bedroom is fucking hot, can't count the number of times I've come back for that.

Not a fan of shota, but I do prefer the canon.
While this route is wholesome as she has someone who can fully support her and cares for, basically perfect for someone like her...
But I found myself more attached to the kid's imperfectness, more specifically, probably his simplistic outlook on relationship.

He may not be the best lover, he cannot even guaranteed for basic financial support, but he tries his best at it despite him pale in comparison to this guy in almost everything. And in the canon, he literally wins her heart only because the guy felt that "she deserves better" and backed off.

Perhaps I just overlooking into this so much that I kinda projected myself into the kid? Maybe. But not that anyone would bother to read this bullshit comment anyway.
...tho I do wish that the artist could do a finale to the canon to see if the kid can hold up to the guy in the end.
I still prefer this over the shouts cannon
